page.title: 08Cows on farms around Haywood
page.content: Freisians are normally used for dairy cattle because they give more milk than Hereford cows. Herefords are mostly crossed with Freisians for beef. Cows which give most milk get more food than cows which do not give much milk. The difference between Freisians and Hereford cross cows is that the Herefords have completely white faces and the Freisians have not. Cows have to be milked very regularly or the milk will start to leak and the yields will begin to drop. The farmers milk their cows twice a day, normally in the morning and in the evening. Farmers rise early each day.
